issue.title: link.meet5.net

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://link.meet5.net](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Flink.meet5.net)
### Comment
> nslookup responds 0.0.0.0.
> 
> > server 94.140.15.15
> Default server: 94.140.15.15
> Address: 94.140.15.15#53
> >
> > link.meet5.net
> Server:         94.140.15.15
> Address:        94.140.15.15#53
> 
> Non-authoritative answer:
> Name:   link.meet5.net
> Address: 0.0.0.0
> Name:   link.meet5.net
> Address: ::
> >

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/hca5nmjvo408c4oscwsskgg004kwowkq7i2thr2ho0.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/7bw4cvfw73gok0s88g408g48ow0o4okipqyexr6q1s.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
System version: | `Android `
Browser: | Chrome

issue.title: hiraethtranslation.com
issue.body:

comment.body:
@Yuki2718 Sorry, can you take a look? Looks like most of these are self-promotion? I checked on

```
https://xissmie.xfolio.jp/@totyuu89
https://nijimiss.moe/@Seunun
```

and the links of the banners are

```
https://xfolio.jp/en/portfolio/blic
https://subscription.nijimiss.app/
https://forum.nijimiss.org/
```

---

Oh, this one is indeed ads: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/221114

Maybe each site needs a separate scriptlet and exclude by the target URL, but I'm not sure if `json-prune` has that capability or not.
